channel.title: NEED HELP! Servers always crash after a couple minutes!
channel.description:
Everytime I start to play a server it works then it crashes after a couple minutes. Everytime it posts a error report in my folder. this is a copy of what it says: # # A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment: # # EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION (0xc0000005) at pc=0x000000006d84a566, pid=6572, tid=7036 # # JRE version: 6.0_18-b07 # Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (16.0-b13 mixed mode windows-amd64 ) # Problematic frame: # V [jvm.dll+0x5a566] # # If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit: # http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp #
--------------- T H R E A D ---------------
Current thread (0x0000000000526000): JavaThread "CompilerThread0" daemon [_thread_in_native, id=7036, stack(0x000000004b0d0000,0x000000004b1d0000)]
siginfo: ExceptionCode=0xc0000005, reading address 0x0000000000000000
Registers: EAX=0x00000000514fff50, EBX=0x000000004df1e1f0, ECX=0x00000000514fff20, EDX=0x000000004b1cc720 ESP=0x000000004b1cc2c0, EBP=0x00000000510237a0, ESI=0x000000004b1cc720, EDI=0x00000000514fff20 EIP=0x000000006d84a566, EFLAGS=0x0000000000010206

Instructions: (pc=0x000000006d84a566) 0x000000006d84a556: e0 48 8b 41 08 4c 8b 60 08 48 8b 68 10 4c 8b f1 0x000000006d84a566: 49 8b 04 24 49 8b cc 45 0f b6 f8 48 8b fa ff 10

Any help would be greatly appriciated. Oh, I just got this computer for christmas if that helps.

item.title: NEED HELP! Servers always crash after a couple minutes!
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

IT IS VERY SIMPLE. THEY ARE ALL SAYING THE RIGHT ANSWER. FIND OUT WHERE YOUR JAVA IS. IT IS EITHER IN C:/Program Files or C:\Program Files (x86) Now if it is in C:\Program Files copy this where it says java or javaw. C:\Program Files\java\jre6\bin\javaw.exe

If it is in Program Files (x86) copy this:

C:\Program Files (x86)\java]jre6\bin\javaw.exe

VERY SIMPLE. EVEN NEWFAGS THAT CANT TRIFORCE CAN FOLLOW THIS DIRECTION.
▲
▲ ▲

Read full topic

item.title: NEED HELP! Servers always crash after a couple minutes!
item.dc:creator: @Flame_Tougne Flame Tougne
item.description:
@Flame_Tougne wrote:

Didn’t make a difference :mad:
I copied the “edit” information of the batch file of the server:
@echo off
Title iScape
cd Client Files
Start javaw -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui

Can that have anything to do with it?
I was using this same client on my other computer for a couple weeks and it worked fine, that computer was running windows XP though. This computer is running Windows 7.
[size=36pt]Please Help! All I want is to play!!![/size]

Read full topic
item.source: NEED HELP! Servers always crash after a couple minutes!

item.title: NEED HELP! Servers always crash after a couple minutes!
item.dc:creator: @Final_Dawn Final Dawn
item.description:
@Final_Dawn wrote:

SDK is what servers are used to run off of. Without SDK you wouldn’t really get very far. Umm, here is a link for a maunal for windows 7 java sdk. In about the middle of the page there is a link for 64-bit java. When your done reading the page, download that and see if you have the same error.

http://www.java.com/en/download/manual.jsp

Read full topic

item.title: NEED HELP! Servers always crash after a couple minutes!
item.dc:creator: @Final_Dawn Final Dawn
item.description:
@Final_Dawn wrote:

OS: Windows 7 Build 7600

CPU:total 2 (2 cores per cpu, 1 threads per core) family 6 model 23 stepping 10, cmov, cx8, fxsr, mmx, sse, sse2, sse3, ssse3, sse4.1

Memory: 4k page, physical 4154308k(1997592k free), swap 8306720k(5829864k free)

There could be several problems here. Since you have 64-bit you might have accidently downloaded the wrong SDK for your computer. If you wish to retry the download I will provide you with a link that will be the correct bit-rate for your OS. Another problem, That one of the files in your Java folder might have been corrupted by something that your computer did anytime. Again, a fix would be to redownload the SDK and try again.

~Fin4l;

Read full topic

-Thanks, Flame Tougne

RE: I tried what oyu said, kind-of… It did not work, it opened up comband prompt (not the one that pops up when i click the server)
[size=36pt]HEEEEELLLLLLLPPPPPPPPPPPPPP[/size]

item.source: NEED HELP! Servers always crash after a couple minutes!

item.title: NEED HELP! Servers always crash after a couple minutes!
item.dc:creator: @sonicforce41 sonicforce41
item.description:
@sonicforce41 wrote:

first what operating system do you have?
I think vista so i am gonna do what i did.
download jdk again and download it to C:/program files (x86)
in the client folder, click edit run.bat.
in the run.bat, if it says:
“start java” or “javaw”
Replace that with
“C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/Jdk1.6.0_##/Bin/Java.exe”
Just “start java” or “javaw”
or it will mess up your client.

Read full topic
item.source: NEED HELP! Servers always crash after a couple minutes!
